Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: Amd -70% since nvda earning report nvda -20% is reasonable

Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: Agreed with you and the same here I don't know why the stock price is so depressing. I wonder if people see NVDA prospect is not promsing, esp in the mobile market. The reasons for that are (1) TXN is exiting the mobil market. That tells investors that making chips for mobile markets is not easily profitable (2) Samsung starts making their own mobile chips based on ARMH core as NVDA, QCOM, and AAPL.. Samsung chips will be used in the new product lines e.g. Nexus 10. Another niche that NVDA has is to design graphic chips for PCs or laptops. And it seems to me that they are ahead of their competitor (ATI/AMD) now. But PC market is shrinking and Intel intergrated graphic chips are very decent for normal graphic use and they will get even better. However, I still think with higiher resolution display for laptop and games, a lof of people still want to have a dedicated graphic that is where NVDA crowns right now. I hope to hear others'opinion.

Topic.Title: Android grabs 41% of tablet market

Message.Msg: Hey ibbey? You quoted the first 3 paragraphs of a very short 5 paragraph story. So how come your didn't quote the next 2 paragraphs? Hummm? Here's what ibbey deliberately omitted -- probably so he wouldn't scare even more nvidia sheep into selling. "Overall, the entire market was up by 43% from 17.2m in the same quarter last year to 24.7m this year - although the analyst firm said that growth was "SLUGGISH" compared to the previous years' growth. THIS QUARTER WAS THE WEAKEST FOR TABLET SALES GROWTH since the iPad arrived in 2010, suggest the market was maturing. "DEMAND FOR TABLETS SLOWED DUE TO ONGOING ECONOMIC UNCERTAINTY AND CONSUMERS HOLDING OFF PURCHASES IN ANTICIPATION OF MULTIPLE NEW MODELS, LIKE THE iPAD MINI, during the upcoming Q4 holiday season," said Neil Mawston, executive director at Strategy Analytics." My my my. -- The WEAKEST quarter for tablet sales growth in the History of Tablets. -- Demand for tablets Slowed due to the crummy economy. -- Folks held-off tablet purchases in anticipation of the Genuine Apple iPad Mini. -- All 24 models of the Mini. You can read the WHOLE TRUTH -- not ibbey's redacted version of the truth, here: Android grabs 41% of tablet market | News | PC Pro

Topic.Title: Android grabs 41% of tablet market

Message.Msg: Thanks Best, Thanks for bringing the Whole Truth to our paid propaganda controlled board. I for one am appalled -- yes Appalled -- at the lies and half-truths from this ibbey guy. 24 hours a day, 364 days a year. This time he deliberately omitted that this quarter was the WEAKEST quarter for tablet sales growth in the Entire History of Tablet Sales? That's it, Best. I'm DONE reading the lies and mis-truths from ibexx88. And on IGNORE he goes. Permanently. Thanks again Best, for your invaluable service to Our board.

Message.Title: 3Q : THE Weakest quarter for tablet sales growth in the Entire History of Tablets.
Message.Msg: 3Q : THE Weakest quarter for tablet sales growth in the Entire History of Tablets. Read it and weep, boys : Android grabs 41% of tablet market | News | PC Pro This fits with the Google 3Q conference call, right? It sure does. Where they apologized for selling only $666 million of Nexus 7 tablets. Which is what, maybe only 1 million units for the quarter. Contributing to THE Weakest quarter for tablet sales growth in the Entire History of Tablets. Hopefully Jen can come clean regarding those disappointing tablet sales during his conference call confessional on November 8th.

Topic.Title: 3Q : THE Weakest quarter for tablet sales growth in the Entire History of Tablets.

Message.Msg: "Overall, the entire market was up by 43% from 17.2m in the same quarter last year to 24.7m this year - although the analyst firm said that growth was "Sluggish" compared to the previous years' growth. THIS QUARTER WAS THE WEAKEST FOR TABLET SALES GROWTH since the iPad arrived in 2010, suggest the market was maturing. "DEMAND FOR TABLETS SLOWED due to ongoing ECONOMIC UNCERTAINTY AND CONSUMERS HOLDING OFF PURCHASES IN ANTICIPATION OF multiple new models, like THE iPAD MINI, during the upcoming Q4 holiday season," said Neil Mawston, executive director at Strategy Analytics." So tablet sales had the Weakest growth in the Entire History of Tablets. The sale of new PC's was the worst in eleven (11) years. And nvida has a miniscule 00.90% of the cellphone market. And the reason to hold nvidia is what again?

Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: qcom has quad A15 products out in market, with full LTE integrated no less. looks like samsung Exynos A15 will be in Nexus 10. Where's Wayne? If 1 yr chip announce to device out, nvda is sitting out the while A15 generation while incurring R&D costs of $250M/Q, $1B/yr. it is evident that nvda does not know how to do cpu, even just linking up cpu with somebody else's proven cores. nvda needs to dump the whole Tegra program and just license their graphics cores.

Message.Msg: Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend. Except current nvidia CEO Jen Hsun Huang. Take a look. 4.10% __ Intel Corporation 3.50% __ Dell Inc. 3.20% __ General Electric (The #1 Most Held Stock by Members of Congress) 3.10% __ Marvell Technology Group Ltd. 3.00% __ Texas Instruments Incorporated 2.60% __ Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation 2.50% __ Sony Corporation 2.01% __ The Average Dividend Return of the 500 Stocks in the S&P 500. 1.70% __ Apple Inc. 1.70% __ Qualcomm Incorporated 1.33% __ Microsoft Corporation 1.30% __ Broadcom Corp. 0.80% __ Oracle Corporation 0.40% __ ARM Holdings Plc 0.00% __ nvidia So nvidia stock has plunged from a year ago, there is no stock buyback, Dear Leader is afraid to make any acquisitions after the icera disaster, and it pays Zero Dividends (0.00%) to its hapless shareholders. Despite an absurd cash hoard of over $3 Billion Dollars of unemployed shareholder's cash. For a company with less than $4 Billion of Annual Gross Revenues. Enjoy your illogical nvda "investment".

Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: I did look at Marvell in that highly educational chart from EE Times. ("Analysts clash over Marvell's apps processor sales - EE Times") Which shows Smartphone Application Processor Shipments (millions of units), for the First Half of 2012. Here. I'll graciously provide it again for Our fine readers. 96.5 million __ Qualcomm, THE King of smartphone application processors 65.6 million __ Apple's self-designed iProcessors 29.9 million __ Samsung processors 23.2 million __ Marvell processors (who would have thought, right boys?) 18.4 million __ Texas Instruments 12.6 million __ Broadcom smartphone processors + on-board cheerleaders 10.9 million __ Mediatek processors 4.6 million __ ST processors 2.4 million __ nvidia 1.1 million __ Spreadstrum Marvell sells Ten Times (10x) as many smartphone application processors as nvidia. 23.2 million sold by Marvell, and just 2.4 million for piker nvidia. AND Marvell pays a nice dividend to their shareholders too. Which nvidia has never done. Nope. Jen just hoards all of the shareholder's cash, for no specific purpose. Marvell looks like the best pick to me.
